alert.note: Alert for Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 22 at 9:01AM AKST until December 22 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation occurring. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch, mainly south and west of Sleetmute. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Lower Kuskokwim Valley. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A warm front will reach the Lower Kuskokwim Valley later this afternoon. Snow is beginning to spread into western portions of the Kuskokwim Valley in advance of the front. This activity should continue to expand eastward through this evening. As temperatures continue to climb, snow is expected to change over to a sleet/freezing rain mix before transitioning entirely to rain with minor accumulations. The greatest threat for sleet and freezing rain will exist to the south and west of Sleetmute while the higher snow accumulations will exist east of Sleetmute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
